hints_html: A linear approximation is the tangent line to the function at a point a. Is the tangent line in this example above or below the graph of \(f(x) = e^x\)?
hints_latex:
A linear approximation is the tangent line to the function at a point
\emph{a}. Is the tangent line in this example above or below the graph
of $f(x) = e^x$?
hints_raw: A linear approximation is the tangent line to the function at a point ''a''.  Is the tangent line in this example above or below the graph of <math>f(x) = e^x</math>?
question: 9 (b)
sols_html:
The function \(\displaystyle f(x) = e^x\) is concave up, so all tangent lines, including our linear approximation, will lie below the graph.

The purple graph is f(x), the blue line is the linear approximation L(x) = x+1 from part (a). Thus our linear approximation is an underestimate.
sols_latex:
The function $\displaystyle f(x) = e^x$ is concave up, so all tangent
lines, including our linear approximation, will lie below the graph.

The purple graph is \emph{f(x)}, the blue line is the linear
approximation \emph{L(x) = x+1} from
{part
(a)}. Thus our linear approximation is an underestimate.

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\includegraphics[width=0.5\textwidth]{../json_data/MATH110/April_2013/Math110_april2013_question9b_solution.jpg}

sols_raw:
The function <math>\displaystyle f(x) = e^x</math> is concave up, so all tangent lines, including our linear approximation, will lie below the graph.

The purple graph is ''f(x)'', the blue line is the linear approximation ''L(x) = x+1'' from [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH110/April_2013/Question_09_(a)|part (a)]]. Thus our linear approximation is an underestimate.

:[[File:Math110 april2013 question9b solution.jpg|300px]]
statement_html: Is your estimate in part (a) greater than, less than, or equal to the actual value of e0.1? Justify your answer.
statement_latex:
Is your estimate in part
{(a)}
greater than, less than, or equal to the actual value of
\emph{e\textsuperscript{0.1}}? Justify your answer.
statement_raw: Is your estimate in part [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH110/April_2013/Question_9_(a)|(a)]] greater than, less than, or equal to the actual value of ''e<sup>0.1</sup>''? Justify your answer.
